lines: It's Saturday morning, and Mom asks you to help with some chores. The Suzy Fantastik Cartoon Hour has just begun.
#TELL MOM YOU WANT TO WATCH CARTOONS
*selectable_if (false) #TELL MOM YOU WANT TO WATCH CARTOONS
#TELL MOM YOU WANT TO WATCH CARTOONS
You say, "Maaaaaaahm... SOOOOOO-ZEEE ith on the TEE-VEE now!" Mom says, "Come on, Sweetie. Help me in the kitchen a little." You say:
Mom sees your stubborness and stops asking you. All she wanted was a little company. You acted very selfishly. She's in the kitchen now.
This Suzy Fantastik is a REPEAT! So there!

You go into the kitchen reluctantly and mope around. You move around alot and touch things that you shouldn't. Mom gets impatient trying to watch you and do work at the same time, so she sends you back to watch television.

You are spread out on the floor in front of the TV. When Mom speaks to you, you put your hands on your face to hold your chin up and pound your foot on the floor. Mom says, "Come on, Sweetie. Help me in the kitchen a little." You say:
Your mom feels hurt and angry. You have rejected her. She turns and walks out. Does this prevent you from enjoying Suzy?
Good. You are developing a guilty conscience. It will help prevent you from leading a wayward life.
You should at least feel a little sorry for behaving the way you did. Little girls can be so rotten!
What a good girl! Mom makes you feel very important.  As a reward, Mom takes out some special make-up and some old clothes.
Just before you play dress-up with Mom, the phone rings. She stays on for a whole two hours!
You put on some real make-up and some of Grandma's old clothes. Mom takes your picture and tells you that you look like a MOVIE STAR!
You really didn't want to go, but you went anyway for Mom's sake. You can:
You shuffle your feet across the floor and don't really pay attention to what you're doing. Mom sends you back to watch TV.
You are already under the trance of the TV set. Mom tries to encourage you away from the TV. Does it work?

You are too busy watching Suzy battle the forces of Evil. You are oblivious to all sights and sounds other than the ones coming from the TV set. Mom tries to encourage you away from the TV. Does it work?
Of course it doesn't. You are becoming a TV addict at a very young age. Before you know it, you will be staying up late, watching old Odd Couple reruns.
